intro: Hypecoum deuteroparviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. The plant is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its unique floral structure and adaptability to various soil types.
